newsitem.title: USA: NACCO gains 10 pct after stock repurchase plan.
newsitem.headline: NACCO gains 10 pct after stock repurchase plan.

text.p: Shares of NACCO Industries Inc climbed over ten percent on Monday after the company announced it would start a Dutch auction tender offer to buyback up to 800,000 shares of its outstanding common stock.
The shares rose 4-1/2 to 47-3/4. The Mayfield Heights, Ohio company said late Friday it would buy the shares back for between $43.50 and $50 each.
The company had about 8.9 million primary shares outstanding at the end of the third quarter.
NACCO makes forklift trucks, sells lignite coal, and makes the Hamilton Beach an Procter Silex lines of kitchen appliances.
